info.title: Evisort API
info.description: OpenAPI specification for Evisort API for integration with 3rd party services

get.summary: Export users spreadsheet for current client

parameters.name: only_headers
parameters.description: Boolean flag that determines whether to export the complete spreadsheet or only the headers. If not defined, it defaults to false.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

parameters.name: ocr
parameters.description: Flag to specify if OCR'd version is requested

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Content type of the document to download, applicable only when ocr is designated 'true' in query. If missing, the format of the original document (pdf or docx) is returned.

302.description: Response redirecting to a pre-authenticated download URL for the document. To download the document, your app must follow the Location header in the response. Pre-authenticated URLs are only valid for a short period of time (a few minutes) and do not require an Authorization header to access.

get.summary: List a document record by docId

get.summary: Get status of a provision record

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The ID of the training record

get.description: Used for searching for documents based on a single query.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Determines the type of search to perform

parameters.name: terms
parameters.description: The term or terms on which you're searching. If the type is "simpletext", this may be repeated.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Needed by some queries for type "field" searches that require multiple arguments.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Required for type "simpletext" searches. Specifies where to look for the given text.

parameters.name: folders
parameters.description: Required for type "folder" searches instead of argument "terms". Is an array of full folder paths. Each folder is expected to start with "Documents/".

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Specifies the exact filtering behavior. The valid options vary depending on the type of search and, for "field" searches, the underlying type of the field.:
  * _All Fields_
    * `isblank` - Field is empty
    * `notisblank` - Field is not empty
  * _Datetime Fields_
    * `before` - Field is before the given date
    * `after` - Field is after the given date
    * `on` - Field is on the given date
    * `between` - Field is between two given dates
    * `next` - Field is in the next X amount of time
    * `last` - Field is in the last X amount of time
  * _Number Fields_
    * `eq` - Field is equal to the given value
    * `lt` - Field is less than the given value
    * `lte` - Field is less than or equal to the given value
    * `gt` - Field is greater than the given value
    * `gte` - Field is greater than or equal to the given value
    * `between` - Field is between the two given values
  * _String Fields_
    * `containstext` - Field contains the given text
    * `notcontainstext` - Field does not contain the given text
  * _Single-select Fields_
    * `equals` - Field equals the given string
    * `notequals` - Field does not equal the given string
  * _Multi-select Fields_
    * `containsany` - Field contains any of the given terms
    * `containsall` - Field contains all of the given terms
    * `notcontainsany` - Field does not contain any of the given terms
  * _Boolean Fields_
    * `equals` - Field equals the given term. Must be either "true" or "false"

post.description: Used for searching for documents based on a queries that are nested and/or combined with "and" or "or".

UserNameHeader.name: X-ACTIVE-USER-NAME
UserNameHeader.description: name of the user making the request

UserEmailHeader.name: X-ACTIVE-USER-EMAIL
UserEmailHeader.description: email of the user making the request

schema.description: Specify the page number of paginated results to return

pageSizeParam.name: pageSize
pageSizeParam.description: Specify the number of results per page.

CompositeSearch.description: Structure for organizing multiple search filters

query.description: List of search filters. Every search filter must be separated by an OperatorSearch object. SectionSearch objects allow for nesting of filters.

OperatorSearch.description: Used to combine other search filters. Cannot be used on its own.

SectionSearch.description: Structure for organizing multiple search filters.

allOf.description: Structure for organizing multiple search filters

query.description: List of search filters. Every search filter must be separated by an OperatorSearch object. SectionSearch objects allow for nesting of filters.

items.description: Additional filters. Can be arbitrarily nested.

category.description: Category options: * `filename` - Search for text within the filename * `content` - Search for text within the file contents * `both` - Search for text within either

filter.description: Filter options: * `containsany` - Looks for text that contains any of the given terms * `containsall` - Looks for text that contains all of the given terms * `containsexact` - Looks for text that contains the exact sequence of terms * `notcontainsany` - Looks for text that does not contain any of the given terms * `notcontainsall` - Looks for text that does not contain all of the given terms * `notcontainsexact` - Looks for text that does not contain the exact sequence of terms

BooleanSearch.description: Search for documents that match custom boolean logic.

query.description: The query to execute. See `https://support.evisort.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042657494-Chart-Boolean-Text-Search-Definitions-and-Examples` for more information.

ProvisionSearch.description: Search for documents based on provisions.

filter.description: Filter options: * `contains` - Matches if document contains the given provision * `notcontains` - Matches if document does not contain the given provision

search_within.description: Optionally look within a provision for the presence or absence of the provided terms. This is only considered if the "filter" is set to "contains". Search Within options: * `containsany` - Looks for text within the given provision that contains any of the given terms * `containsall` - Looks for text within the given provision that contains all of the given terms * `containsexact` - Looks for text within the given provision that contains the exact sequence of terms * `notcontainsany` - Looks for text within the given provision that does not contain any of the given terms * `notcontainsall` - Looks for text within the given provision that does not contain all of the given terms * `notcontainsexact` - Looks for text within the given provision that does not contain the exact sequence of terms

terms.description: List of terms to for within a provision of with the given "name"

FolderSearch.description: Search for documents within a given set of folders.

type.description: Search for documents within a given set of folders.

folders.description: List of folder paths to search on. Each folder needs to start with Documents/. Cannot include the root folder.

FieldSearch.description: Search for documents based on field information. The arguments needed depend on the underlying type for the field specified.

filter.description:
Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Field is empty
  * `notisblank` - Field is not empty
  * `before` - Field is before the given date
  * `after` - Field is after the given date
  * `on` - Field is on the given date
  * `between` - Field is between two given dates
  * `next` - Field is in the next X amount of time
  * `last` - Field is in the last X amount of time

terms.description: Required if filter is not "isblank" or "notisblank". If filter is "before", "after", "on", or "between", expects a date-parsable string. If filter is "next" or "last", expects a number.

additional.description: Required if filter is "between", "next", or "last". If filter is "between", expects a date-parsable string. If filter is "next" or "last", expects a string of either "day", "week", "month", or "year".

filter.description:
Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Field is empty
  * `notisblank` - Field is not empty
  * `eq` - Field is equal to the given value
  * `lt` - Field is less than the given value
  * `lte` - Field is less than or equal to the given value
  * `gt` - Field is greater than the given value
  * `gte` - Field is greater than or equal to the given value
  * `between` - Field is between the two given values

terms.description: Required if filter is not "isblank" or "notisblank".

filter.description:
Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Field is empty
  * `notisblank` - Field is not empty
  * `containstext` - Field contains the given text
  * `notcontainstext` - Field does not contain the given text

terms.description: Required if filter is not "isblank" or "notisblank".

Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Field is empty

  * `equals` - Field equals the given string

terms.description: Required if filter is not "isblank" or "notisblank"

filter.description:
Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Field is empty
  * `notisblank` - Field is not empty
  * `containsany` - Field contains any of the given terms
  * `containsall` - Field contains all of the given terms
  * `notcontainsany` - Field does not contain any of the given terms

terms.description: Required if filter is not "isblank" or "notisblank"

filter.description:
Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Does not have attachments
  * `notisblank` - Has attachments

Filter options:
  * `isblank` - Field is empty
  * `notisblank` - Field is not empty
  * `equals` - Field equals the given term. Must be either "true" or "false"

terms.description: Required if filter is not "isblank" or "notisblank"

fields.description: Stringified JSON, array of `Field` schema objects. Note that string values cannot exceed 5000 characters.

uploadPath.description: "/" separated path to the folder to contain the uploaded file. Will create the specified folder structure if it does not already exist.

fields.description: Array of `Field` schema objects. Note that string values cannot exceed 5000 characters.

UsersExportFile.example: User ID=1234 Email=user@evisort.com FirstName=User LastName=Evisort JobTitle=Dev AccessLevel=Admin Department= LastAccess=21/07/2011 10:30:00 WorkflowAdmin=No

import_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

email_new_users.description: Boolean flag that determines whether to send an email to new users or not (non existing users in the DB, but present in the spreadsheet). If not defined, it defaults to false.

update_existing_users.description: Boolean flag that determines whether to update existing users or not (already existing users in the DB). If not defined, it defaults to false.

delete_missing_users.description: Boolean flag that determines whether to delete missing users or not (users in the DB but not in the spreadsheet). If not defined, it defaults to false.

client_id.description: Number that determines the id of the current Client.

import_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

task_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the celery task.

id.description: Number that determines the id of the import process.

client_id.description: Number that determines the id of the current Client.

import_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

user_id.description: Number that determines the id of the user that created the import process.

task_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the celery task.

acknowledged.description: Indicates whether the import process has been requested to be acknowledged.

start.description: Start timestamp of the import process.

end.description: End timestamp of the import process.

total.description: Total count of user records to be processed.

errors.description: Actual count of user records with errors.

client_id.description: Number that determines the id of the current Client.

import_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

total.description: Total count of user records to be processed.

new_users.description: Count of new users to be created.

existing.description: Count of existing users to be updated.

to_be_deleted.description: Count of users to be deleted.

errors.description: Count of user records with errors.

client_id.description: Number that determines the id of the current Client.

import_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

client_id.description: Number that determines the id of the current Client.

import_id.description: String GUID that determines the id of the current Import summary and process. This identifier identifies each file.

label.description: The display value for the field

name.description: The internal name for the field

helpText.description: Optional display string for extra instructions relating to this field

active.description: Indicates whether this field is currently visible

allowedValues.description: The available selectable values for the field. Used with "single_select" and sometimes "multi_select". An empty array means any value is accepted.

docId.description: Could be null for documents not uploaded via the API

count.description: The total number of unique documents found in the search. If this is larger than the page size, additional results can be found on other pages.

next.description: The url for the next page of results.

previous.description: The url for the previous page of results.

fileDetails.description: An array of all identical documents in the system that match the query. These documents share the same field, provision, and status metadata.

docId.description: Could be null for documents not uploaded via the API

provisions.description: A list of provision types with any associated training text used to generate them

details.description: The aggregated status of the training request

TypeEnum.description:
Type values:
  * `string` - String value, 5000 character limit
  * `number` - Number value, stored as a Float
  * `boolean` - Boolean value
  * `datetime` - Datetime value
  * `multi_select` - An array of String values
  * `single_select` - A single string from a list of options

items.description: a list of operands and operators as string tokens in infix notation.

fieldId.description: a reference to ticket's workflow intake form fields

value.description: the structure of the value is dependent on the type of the value.

IntakeFormFieldValueFile.description: Attachments are defined either as a pre-existing entity already known to the system or as a reference to an external entity that will need to be fetched.

file.description: An integration specific payload. This contains references to the current version data in the integration system.

form.description: The intake form of a ticket workflow.

id.description: the id of a condition from the workflow conditions list

options.description: this field is deprecated, but exists for historical reasons

customSettings.description: the structure of the custom settings is dependent on the type of the field.

AuthResponse.description: Successful Authentication response containing JWT access token

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid

UsersImportListResponse.description: List of a user import processes

UsersImportStatusResponse.description: Status of a user import process

UsersImportSummaryResponse.description: Summary of a user import process
